Articles.Content:
Floor 183: A Floor that tells you

WELCOME TO LOW EARTH(Kerbin)ORBIT

Floor 184: Yet another sign:

Ignore the sign on the previous floor, you're closer to the moon's orbit than the ISS's orbit.

Floor 185 from Earth (50 from the Moon... err Luna): A sign:

Welcome to the Moon (Luna)! Get ready to spin yourself to walk on the Moon and perhaps underground...
Edited July 10, 2013 by Designer225

Floor 186: You are feeling Luna's gravity pulling on your head.

It seems that the skyscraper (spacescraper?) is breaking apart again (the 237th floor is in Luna).

Floor 187 (48 from Luna): A sign:

Thank goodness you survived the pull. There is no turning back (though you have to turn around to the right side), you must get in deeper!

Hint: Floor 237 is in Luna, and Floor 287 is where you would return to Earth's gravitational field... but there is no turning back. You must venture deeper.
Floor 188: Other signs were lying, this floor is a 90Ã‚Â° turn.
Floor 189: You open the door, and you're on an island surrounded by water. It seems you somehow ended up back on Earth.
Floor 190: You actually found out you are on Europa.
Floor 191: The Springfield Monorail!
Floor 192 from Earth (10 from Pluto): For some reason the Quantum Space Traveler malfunctioned, causing you to travel into Pluto.
Floor 193: Xeldrak's interdimensional coffee-bean storage facility
Floor 194: A museum dedicated to the Voyager missions.

Floor 195: There is a sign that says:

You are now less than 100 feet way from Pluto!

Floor 195 (39 from Luna): There is another sign:

I lied! Also there is a bad horrible evil ship in the window.
196! A soyuz for Jeb to climb into thanks to Bobcat!
197: A bunch of random notes, scary games, and a computer with minecraft open

Floor 198 (4 from Pluto and 2 from lowest Charon Periapsis): A sign:

Hello my friend! You are inside the gravitational field of Charon! Face Pluto, please! --- Jeb

Floor 199: Jebediah Kerman; he tells you that there's a weird bend in spacetime that puts you near Luna (Earth's moon) and Pluto at the same time. The concept almost causes your head to explode, but you cover your ears before your brain gets too overloaded.
Floor 200: Nothing here, just a couple of dudes in suits.
Floor 201: Nothing
Floor 202: The faulty Quantum Portal in Floor 201 teleported you to heliosheath.
Floor 203: The eternal Oktoberfest
Floor 204: You see some Communists celebrating October 1st. (That's the date of one of the Chinese national holiday, in case if you didn't know.)
Floor 205: The First World Bank

Floor 206 (Floor 9,000,000 from the center of Milky Way): Once again the damn teleporter went defective and teleported you to the heliopause. Your solar boat won't work here, so use hyperdrives extensively.
